channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024110323
item.description:
Report E-2024110323

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T00:59:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:25ET XPO called to report a 15-gallon release of a toxic material "Pyrethroid pesticide" from a 55-gallon DM. The drum was punctuated by a forklift blade. The terminal cleaned up the release prior to calling ERTS. Waste was placed for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110411
item.description:
Report X-2024110411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-15T12:23:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with an odor was presented to the MEMH spill office. While investigating the shipment the agent found that the bottom chime of the metal can inside was damaged causing a release. The can was packaged in a plastic bag with a fiberboard divider and a empty can for dunnage. It was placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper will be contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report E-2024110192
item.description:
Report E-2024110192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-13T12:22:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0325 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal NKX. It was reported that approximately 0.5-gallonsof INTERTHERM 181 GRAY PART A released from a plastic bucket due to improper packaging. The release impacted inside of trailer #3115871. Terminal personnel had proper PPE to handle.
